intro: Corydalis brevirostrata, commonly known as the narrow-beaked corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and produces small, oval-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its blooming period occurs in spring, and it thrives in well-drained, moist soils in partial shade. Corydalis brevirostrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine.
